intro: Grumilea urdanetensis, commonly known as the UrdaNetensis plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hirsute stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features include palmate leaves and a tendency to form shrub-like growth habits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
